basics.label: Director of Aviation and Safety
basics.summary: Experienced aviation professional with notable expertise in training, maintenance, safety management, and military intelligence. Skilled in leadership, risk management, and labor-management relations with a strong ability in project, budget management and personnel affairs.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Supervise an Army Aviation Support Facility consisting of 63 employees that perform maintenance and flight training for the Montana Army National Guard. My mission is to direct the maintenance for 22 helicopters and train the 140 assigned aircrew members.
highlights: Develop training relationships with federal, tribal, state, and local agencies.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Direct and coordinate all flight operations and training for the Army Aviation Support Facility and its supported military units consisting of 22 aircraft and approximately 140 air crew members.
highlights: Plan work assignments and professional development for subordinates
Investigate aircraft mishaps in accordance with US Army regulations.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Performed a variety of duties to include rotary wing instructor pilot, assistant operations officer, section leader, platoon leader, executive officer, and detachment commander.
highlights: Served in a general aviation company and an aviation training company while stationed at FT Rucker, AL
Served as a unit Commander and a fixed wing pilot in command in a military intelligence - low intensity battalion forward deployed in Honduras

education.area: Aeronautical Sciences with a dual emphasis on Management and Safety Systems
